required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Artificial Intelligence to Assess the Association Between Facial Characteristics and Coronary Artery Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: Artificial Intelligence to Assess the Association Between Facial Characteristics and Coronary Artery Diseases

lead_sponsor.agency: China National Center for Cardiovascular Diseases

clinical_study.source: China National Center for Cardiovascular Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: The purposes of this study are 1) to explore the association between facial characteristics and the increased risk of coronary artery diseases; 2) to evaluate the diagnostic efficacy of appearance factors for coronary artery diseases.

detailed_description.textblock:
Several age-related appearance factors were described associated with increased risk of coronary artery diseases (CAD). However, several limitations made these facial risk factors hard to be utilized in clinical practice, including 1) low prevalence in CAD patients, 2) lack of specific definition, 3) poor reproducibility in artificial recognition.
Thus, the investigators designed a multi-center, cross-sectional study to explore the association between facial characteristics and CAD and evaluate the diagnostic efficacy of appearance factors for CAD. The investigators will recruit patients undergoing coronary angiography or coronary computer tomography angiography. Patients' baseline information and facial images will be collected. First, the investigators will explore the facial factors associated with CAD by using artificial intelligence technology to compare facial photographs between patients with CAD and without CAD. Secondary, the investigators will evaluate the dose-response relationship between facial characteristics and CAD. Third, the investigators will establish a CAD risk model based on facial factors, and evaluate the diagnostic effect of the model.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of enrollment (6 months)
primary_outcome.description: The sensitivity of coronary artery diagnostic model assessed in model test group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of enrollment (6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The specificity of coronary artery diagnostic model assessed in model test group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of enrollment (6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under receiver operating curve (AUC) of diagnostic model assessed in model test group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of enrollment (6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: PPV of diagnostic model assessed in model test group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of enrollment (6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: NPV of diagnostic model assessed in model test group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of enrollment (6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Diagnostic accuracy rate of diagnostic model assessed in model test group

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing coronary angiography or coronary computer tomography angiography will be enrolled. Patients data will be used to establish the facial based diagnostic model of coronary artery diseases, and to prospectively validate the diagnostic effectiveness of the model.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who undergo coronary angiography or coronary computer tomography angiography from both resident patients and outpatient.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Undergoing coronary angiography or coronary computer tomography angiography
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI)
- Prior coronary artery bypass graft (CABG)
- Screening coronary artery disease before treating other heart diseases
- Without blood biochemistry outcome
- With artificially facial alteration (i.e. cosmetic surgery, facial trauma or make-up)
- Other situations which make patients fail to be photographed

facility.name: Guanganmen Hospital, Chinese Academy of Traditional Chinese Medicine
The first affiliated hospital of Dalian medical university
The fisrt affiliated hospital of Wenzhou medical university
